question.text: If 10,000 J of energy is present at the T1 level, then what is the energy available at the <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> level?

solution.text: According to the 10 percent law, only 10% of the energy is transferred to each trophic level from its lower trophic level. If 10,000 joules of energy is available to the producer, then only 1000 joules  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>10000</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>×</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>1000</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>  of energy will be available to the primary consumer and only 100 joules  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mo>×</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>  of energy will be available to  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  organism.
